name: Colchester United FC History Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1937.

	Colchester Town were founded in 1874, but it wasn't until 1937 when Colchester United evolved from that club.

questions.text: Who was the first manager in the club's history?
questions.explanation:
Ted Fenton.

	Ted Fenton was Colchester's manager between 1946-48, and was replaced by Jimmy Allen (1948-53), followed by Butler (1953-55), and Benny Fenton managed the club between 1955-63.Note: Ted Davis was part-time Secretary-Manager 1936-37, followed by Syd Fieldus after the war for one season: 1945-46. The first manager was Ted Fenton.

questions.text: Which top-flight team did Colchester beat in a 1970-71 FA Cup 5th Round match?
questions.explanation:
Leeds United.

	The game took place on 13th February, 1971 at Layer Road, when Colchester ran out 3-2 winners. They were thumped 5-0 by Everton in the quarter-finals, and Leeds went on to finish as runners-up of Division One to Arsenal who completed the double of League and FA Cup triumphs.

questions.text: Which of these made the most League appearances for the club?
questions.explanation:
Micky Cook.

	Cook played 613 League games for Colchester, between 1969-84.

questions.text: When the club were relegated from the Football League in 1989-90, they were promoted again two years later, in 1991-92. How many games did they lose in the promotion season?
questions.explanation:
4.

	Season 1990-91 saw the club finish second to Barnet, but a year later, were promoted again with 94 points. Wycombe Wanderers had the same amount of points, but it was Colchester's Championship as they had a +9 better goal difference.

questions.text: Who did Colchester beat in the 1961-62 season, which set a record for their highest League victory?
questions.explanation:
Bradford City.

	Colchester won 9-1 vs. Bradford City in the 1961-62 Division Four season.

questions.text: Where did Colchester sign Scott McGleish from in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Barnet.

	McGleish started his career with non-League Edgeware Town in 1993, and actually had a three month loan with Colchester in 1996.

questions.text: Which of these scored the most League goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Hunt.

	Bobby Hunt scored 37 goals in the 1961-62 Division Four season.

questions.text: In which season did the club first play in the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1950-51.

	Colchester finished 16th out of 24 teams that season, with 40 points.

questions.text: Which club did Colchester sell Lua Lua to in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Newcastle United.

	Congo forward Lua Lua signed for Newcastle on 19th September, 2000. His full name is Lomano Tresor Lua Lua.
